Chapter 2 How to use tools 2.1 To th mc làm vic 2.2 Chèn hình nh 2.3 Chèn video 2.4 Vn phm ting Anh 2.5 Trích dn 2.6 Cú pháp Markdown 2.7 Setup Github cho RStudio 2.8 Tham kho

Chapter 2 How to use tools 2.1 To th mc làm vic Khi s dng Rstudio thì nên to th mc project  toàn b files s nm trong ó. Cách thc hin xem  ây https://alexd106.github.io/intro2R/howto.html#rstudio_proj-vid Li th là trong folder project này, ta có th to các folder con nh images, data, tables,   thun tin lu riêng tng loi d liu. [hin ti làm sao  cu hình cho hình nh nó t ng lu theo tng folder thì cha bit cách, thy có package here mà không bit cách dùng). Lu ý là khi dùng bookdown  render books thì tên ca heading là ghi ting Anh cho lành, vì nu ghi ting Vit thì nó render b li unicode. RStudio Projects from intro 2R on Vimeo. 2.2 Chèn hình nh Có các cách chèn hình khi s dng Rstudio nh sau:  Chuyn qua ch  Visual ri insert hình nh. Sau ó hình nh s c lu trong folder _book/images khi render bng knitr.  Nu gõ theo kiu source code thì dùng on mã sau ``` {r echo=TRUE, paged.print=FALSE, out.width="30%"} knitr::include_graphics("images/cover.jpg") ``` knitr::include_graphics("images/cover.jpg")  Nu copy và paste t trên Internet thì dùng add-on imageclipr <https://github.com/Toniiiio/imageclipr>. Hình nh s lu mc nh trong working directory.  Nu copy và paste hình nh theo kiu th công thì hình nh mc nh s lu  C:/Users/tandu/AppData/Local/RStudio/tmp/paste-B717C571.png nh vy thì khi xut bn online s không thy. Do ó phi a hình nh vào trong th mc project (theo kiu th công) hoc dùng add-on imageclipr theo kiu trc tip trong Rstudio (nhng  dng Rmarkdown, còn Rmarkdown visual thì b li). 2.3 Chèn video S dng link này https://video-to-markdown.marcomontalbano.com/ (theo kiu click vào hình ri direct qua source  play video) Chèn t Youtube, s dng code embed ri paste vào. <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RLxV3T2b524" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe> Tuy nhiên video s không t ng resize theo khung ca s Nên dùng code này  video t ng resize. Chiu rng và cao 100% có ngha là theo khung ca s ch không phi theo kích thc gc ca video. <div style="position:relative;padding-bottom:56.25%;"> <iframe style="width:100%;height:100%;position:absolute;left:0px;top:0px;" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="100%" allowfullscreen src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/RLxV3T2b524"> </iframe> </div> Chèn t Github, lu ý v trí ng dn ca file (k c trong sub folder phi chính xác) và repo phi to Gitpage. Video s play khi m bng trình duyt. <div style="position:relative;padding-bottom:56.25%;"> <iframe style="width:100%;height:100%;position:absolute;left:0px;top:0px;" frameborder="0" width="100%" height="100%" allowfullscreen src="https://tanduc307.github.io/xstk/images/thanks.mp4"> </iframe> </div> Có th dùng package vembedr https://ijlyttle.github.io/vembedr/  insert video cho nhanh. 2.4 Vn phm ting Anh Cách s dng du ba chm ellipses. https://t.me/c/1605387342/140 Cách chèn âm thanh vào theo cách upload lên github ri play t URL. Cha tìm ra cách play t source trên hard disk. S dng package embedr https://github.com/mccarthy-m-g/embedr library(embedr) embed_audio(src = "https://tanduc307.github.io/light/An%20ellipsis%20(plural_%20ellipses)%20is%20a%20punctuation%20mark%20consisting%20of%20three%20dots..mp3") Your browser does not support the audio tag; for browser support, please see: https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_audio.asp 2.5 Trích dn Xem hng dn  ây là làm c https://inbo.github.io/tutorials/tutorials/r_citations_markdown/ 2.6 Cú pháp Markdown Xem  ây https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/ 2.7 Setup Github cho RStudio Mc ích là  thun tin lu tr toàn b d liu ca d án R mà khi cn copy, save as th công. https://intro2r.com/github_r.html Khi có file nào ó thay i thì  Tab Git này s update ngay. Ta ch cn chn Ctrl+A ri Space  select all sau ó commit ri mi push lên server Git  lu tr. 2.8 Tham kho https://rstats.wtf/

guide.html

Chapter 4 Guide 4.1 Inline formatting 4.2 Listings 4.3 Media 4.4 Images 4.5 Math expressions 4.6 Number and reference equations 4.7 Theorems and proofs 4.8 Text references 4.9 R code 4.10 Figures 4.11 Tables

Chapter 4 Guide 4.1 Inline formatting work or work yes or yes H2O Ca2+ code Small Caps RStudio Footnote1 If you do not want a certain heading to be numbered, you can add {-} after the heading, e.g # Preface {-} Blockquotes are written after >, e.g., Love the life you live, Live the life you love.  Bob Marley Code blocks 4.2 Listings Unordered list items start with *, -, or +, and you can nest one list within another list by indenting the sub-list by four spaces, e.g., one item one item one item one item one item Ordered list items start with numbers (the rule for nested lists is the same as above), e.g., the first item the second item the third item 4.3 Media Mình ci thôi em 4.4 Images Chèn theo syntax trong markdown Chèn t link s dng th HTML <img src="link.png" alt="caption" style="height: 100px; width:100px;"/> Xem thêm https://www.markdownguide.org/hacks/#image-size 4.5 Math expressions Ma trn dãy s \[\begin{array}{ccc} x_{11} & x_{12} & x_{13}\\ x_{21} & x_{22} & x_{23} \end{array}\] Ma trn \[X = \begin{bmatrix}1 & x_{1}\\ 1 & x_{2}\\ 1 & x_{3} \end{bmatrix}\] \[\Theta = \begin{pmatrix}\alpha & \beta\\ \gamma & \delta \end{pmatrix}\] \[\begin{vmatrix}a & b\\ c & d \end{vmatrix}=ad-bc\] 4.6 Number and reference equations \[\begin{equation} f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k} \tag{4.1} \end{equation}\] You may refer to it using \@ref(eq:binom), e.g., see Equation (4.1). Công thc mô t a normal frequency curve \[\begin{equation} f = \frac{N}{{(\sigma \sqrt {2\pi } )}}{e^{ - {{(y - \mu )}^2}/2{\sigma ^2}}} \tag{4.2} \end{equation}\] You may refer to it using \@ref(eq:normal), e.g., see Equation (4.2). Nu không ánh s công thc thì dùng equation* \[\begin{equation*} \frac{d}{dx}\left( \int_{a}^{x} f(u)\,du\right)=f(x) \end{equation*}\] Nu ghi theo kiu align thì áp dng \[\begin{align} g(X_{n}) &= g(\theta)+g'({\tilde{\theta}})(X_{n}-\theta) \notag \\ \sqrt{n}[g(X_{n})-g(\theta)] &= g'\left({\tilde{\theta}}\right) \sqrt{n}[X_{n}-\theta ] \tag{4.3} \end{align}\] S dng \notag  giúp không ánh s công thc  hàng u tiên ca (4.3) Nu s dng split thì áp dng \[\begin{equation} \begin{split} \mathrm{Var}(\hat{\beta}) & =\mathrm{Var}((X'X)^{-1}X'y)\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}X'\mathrm{Var}(y)((X'X)^{-1}X')'\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}X'\mathrm{Var}(y)X(X'X)^{-1}\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}X'\sigma^{2}IX(X'X)^{-1}\\ & =(X'X)^{-1}\sigma^{2} \end{split} \tag{4.4} \end{equation}\] 4.7 Theorems and proofs Theorem 4.1 (Pythagorean theorem) For a right triangle, if \(c\) denotes the length of the hypotenuse and \(a\) and \(b\) denote the lengths of the other two sides, we have \[a^2 + b^2 = c^2\] 4.8 Text references You can assign some text to a label and reference the text using the label elsewhere in your document. This can be particularly useful for long figure/table captions. 4.9 R code There are two types of R code in R Markdown/knitr documents: R code chunks, and inline R code. The syntax for the latter is `r R_CODE`, and it can be embedded inline with other document elements. 4.10 Figures If we assign a figure caption to a code chunk via the chunk option fig.cap, R plots will be put into figure environments, which will be automatically labeled and numbered, and can also be cross-referenced. The label of a figure environment is generated from the label of the code chunk. Cross reference cho Figure 4.1 par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1)) plot(pressure, pch = 19, type = 'b') Figure 4.1: A figure example with the specified aspect ratio, width, and alignment. Chèn hai  th 4.2 par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1)) plot(pressure, pch = 19, type = 'b') plot(cars, pch = 19) Figure 4.2: Two plots placed side by side. Chèn hình nh knitr::include_graphics('images/michael.jpg') Figure 4.3: Never let anyone know your mind. Chèn lp li hình nh knitr::include_graphics(rep('images/turtle.jpg', 3)) Figure 4.4: Finding good land. 4.11 Tables Like figures, tables with captions will also be numbered and can be referenced. Table 4.1 is a simple example. knitr::kable( head(mtcars[, 1:8], 10), booktabs = TRUE, caption = 'A table of the first 10 rows of the mtcars data.' ) Table 4.1: A table of the first 10 rows of the mtcars data. mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs Mazda RX4 21.0 6 160.0 110 3.90 2.620 16.46 0 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6 160.0 110 3.90 2.875 17.02 0 Datsun 710 22.8 4 108.0 93 3.85 2.320 18.61 1 Hornet 4 Drive 21.4 6 258.0 110 3.08 3.215 19.44 1 Hornet Sportabout 18.7 8 360.0 175 3.15 3.440 17.02 0 Valiant 18.1 6 225.0 105 2.76 3.460 20.22 1 Duster 360 14.3 8 360.0 245 3.21 3.570 15.84 0 Merc 240D 24.4 4 146.7 62 3.69 3.190 20.00 1 Merc 230 22.8 4 140.8 95 3.92 3.150 22.90 1 Merc 280 19.2 6 167.6 123 3.92 3.440 18.30 1 If you want to put multiple tables in a single table environment, wrap the data objects (usually data frames in R) into a list. See Table 4.2 for an example. Please note that this feature is only available in HTML and PDF output. knitr::kable( list( head(iris[, 1:2], 3), head(mtcars[, 1:3], 5) ), caption = 'A Tale of Two Tables.', booktabs = TRUE ) Table 4.2: A Tale of Two Tables. Sepal.Length Sepal.Width 5.1 3.5 4.9 3.0 4.7 3.2 mpg cyl disp Mazda RX4 21.0 6 160 Mazda RX4 Wag 21.0 6 160 Datsun 710 22.8 4 108 Hornet 4 Drive 21.4 6 258 Hornet Sportabout 18.7 8 360 Longtable. Nu dùng trong HTML thì áp dng on code. Còn nu dùng trong PDF thì add \usepackage{longtable} vào phn LaTeX preamble. knitr::kable( iris[1:55, ], longtable = TRUE, booktabs = TRUE, caption = 'A table generated by the longtable package.' ) Table 4.3: A table generated by the longtable package. Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa 4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa 4.6 3.4 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.0 3.4 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.4 2.9 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.1 1.5 0.1 setosa 5.4 3.7 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.4 1.6 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.0 1.4 0.1 setosa 4.3 3.0 1.1 0.1 setosa 5.8 4.0 1.2 0.2 setosa 5.7 4.4 1.5 0.4 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.3 0.4 setosa 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.7 3.8 1.7 0.3 setosa 5.1 3.8 1.5 0.3 setosa 5.4 3.4 1.7 0.2 setosa 5.1 3.7 1.5 0.4 setosa 4.6 3.6 1.0 0.2 setosa 5.1 3.3 1.7 0.5 setosa 4.8 3.4 1.9 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.0 1.6 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.4 1.6 0.4 setosa 5.2 3.5 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.2 3.4 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.7 3.2 1.6 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.1 1.6 0.2 setosa 5.4 3.4 1.5 0.4 setosa 5.2 4.1 1.5 0.1 setosa 5.5 4.2 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.2 1.2 0.2 setosa 5.5 3.5 1.3 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.6 1.4 0.1 setosa 4.4 3.0 1.3 0.2 setosa 5.1 3.4 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.5 1.3 0.3 setosa 4.5 2.3 1.3 0.3 setosa 4.4 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.5 1.6 0.6 setosa 5.1 3.8 1.9 0.4 setosa 4.8 3.0 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.1 3.8 1.6 0.2 setosa 4.6 3.2 1.4 0.2 setosa 5.3 3.7 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.3 1.4 0.2 setosa 7.0 3.2 4.7 1.4 versicolor 6.4 3.2 4.5 1.5 versicolor 6.9 3.1 4.9 1.5 versicolor 5.5 2.3 4.0 1.3 versicolor 6.5 2.8 4.6 1.5 versicolor To table th công. Chapter 5 Basic blocks 5.1 Subsets Ngun (de Vries and Meys 2015, 241) str(islands) ## Named num [1:48] 11506 5500 16988 2968 16 ... ## - attr(*, "names")= chr [1:48] "Africa" "Antarctica" "Asia" "Australia" ... islands ## Africa Antarctica Asia Australia Axel Heiberg Baffin Banks Borneo ## 11506 5500 16988 2968 16 184 23 280 ## Britain Celebes Celon Cuba Devon Ellesmere Europe Greenland ## 84 73 25 43 21 82 3745 840 ## Hainan Hispaniola Hokkaido Honshu Iceland Ireland Java Kyushu ## 13 30 30 89 40 33 49 14 ## Luzon Madagascar Melville Mindanao Moluccas New Britain New Guinea New Zealand (N) ## 42 227 16 36 29 15 306 44 ## New Zealand (S) Newfoundland North America Novaya Zemlya Prince of Wales Sakhalin South America Southampton ## 58 43 9390 32 13 29 6795 16 ## Spitsbergen Sumatra Taiwan Tasmania Tierra del Fuego Timor Vancouver Victoria ## 15 183 14 26 19 13 12 82 Subset elements References
example-1.html
Chapter 6 EXAMPLE 1 6.1 DOWNLOAD DATA 6.2 GII BÀI TP

Chapter 6 EXAMPLE 1 Source: Programming Assignment 3 INSTRUCTIONS: Hospital Quality [R Programming Coursera] Idea: Yêu cu  bài Download data: D liu  bài 6.1 DOWNLOAD DATA if(!file.exists("./example/1/rprog_data_ProgAssignment3-data.zip")) # KIM TRA XEM CÓ FILE NÀY Ã DOWNLOAD TRONG TH MC CHA # NU CHA CÓ THÌ TIN HÀNH DOWNLOAD VÀ GII NÉN { url <- "https://tanduc307.github.io/xstk/example/1/rprog_data_ProgAssignment3-data.zip" # GÁN GIÁ TR LINK DOWNLOAD library(here) # S DNG PACKAGE 'here'  TO NG DN CHO TIN working_wd <- getwd() # GÁN GIÁ TR TH MC LÀM VIC destfile <- here(working_wd, "example", "1", "rprog_data_ProgAssignment3-data.zip") # GÁN GIÁ TR V TRÍ FILE S DOWNLOAD download.file(url, destfile) # DOWNLOAD FILE V TH MC LÀM VIC unzip_folder <- here(working_wd, "example", "1") # GÁN GIÁ TR V TRÍ FILE S GII NÉN unzip(zipfile = destfile, exdir = unzip_folder) # GII NÉN FILE list.files(unzip_folder) # LIT KÊ CÁC FILE TRONG TH MC SAU GII NÉN } # KT THÚC HÀM IF 6.2 GII BÀI TP Bn nên dùng MS Excel  m các bng d liu này ra  có cái nhìn v toàn b d liu và cách trích xut d liu th công theo yêu cu  bài s gm nhng bc nào. T ây khi vit hàm vào R s có th d dàng i chiu kt qu. 6.2.1 TÌM RA BANG NÀO CÓ T L BNH THP NHT Finding the best hospital in a state Lu hàm  file best.R best <- function(state_real, outcome_real) # T HÀM TÊN LÀ 'best', CÓ HAI THÔNG S LÀ 'state_real' là tên ca bang; 'outcome_real' là t l bnh. { # NHP D LIU library(here) working_wd <- getwd() file_outcome_csv <- here(working_wd, "example", "1", "outcome-of-care-measures.csv") outcome <- read.csv(file_outcome_csv, colClasses = "character", na.strings = "Not Available") lean_data <- outcome[, c(2, 7, 11, 17, 23)] colnames(lean_data) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") unique_name <- unique(lean_data$state) if (match(state_real, unique_name, nomatch = "0") > 0) { } else { print("invalid state") stop() } if (match(outcome_real, c("heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia"), nomatch = "0") > 0) { } else { print("invalid outcome") stop() } lean_data_state <- split(lean_data, f = list(lean_data$state)) foo <- data.frame(lean_data_state[state_real]) colnames(foo) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") #work <- data.frame(cbind(foo$hospital_name, foo$"outcome_real")) # KHI T TRONG HÀM THÌ KHÔNG DÙNG KIU SUBSET DU '$' C, NÊN PHI CHUYN QUA KIU NÀY. work <- data.frame(cbind(foo[, c("hospital_name", outcome_real)])) good <- complete.cases(work) work_ok <- data.frame(work[good, ][]) # TO DATASET CA STATE VI CT BNH VÀ LOI I MISSING VALUE colnames(work_ok) <- c("hospital_name", outcome_real) yes <- as.numeric(work_ok[, outcome_real]) happy <- work_ok[which(yes == min(yes)), ] # LU Ý SYNTAX KHI DÙNG HÀM WHICH result_1 <- paste(happy[1]) # LY TÊN CA BNH VIN CÓ T L BNH ÍT NHT return(result_1) # TR KT QU TÌM KIM } # KT THÚC HÀM 6.2.1.1 TEST HÀM Khi test hàm thì on code  trên c lu  file best.R, ta có th source(best.R)  R thc hin. best("TX", "heart attack") ## [1] "CYPRESS FAIRBANKS MEDICAL CENTER" best("TX", "heart failure") ## [1] "FORT DUNCAN MEDICAL CENTER" best("MD", "heart attack") ## [1] "JOHNS HOPKINS HOSPITAL, THE" best("MD", "pneumonia") ## [1] "GREATER BALTIMORE MEDICAL CENTER" 6.2.1.2 TEST LI NHP LIU Trong hàm ã thit lp thông báo cho ngi nhp liu nu ghi sai tên bang hay ghi sai tên bnh s hin ra thông báo li nhp liu  iu chnh. best("BB", "heart attack") ==> "invalid state" best("NY", "hert attack") ==> "invalid outcome" 6.2.2 TÌM BNH VIN THEO HNG Ranking hospitals by outcome in a state Lu hàm  file rankhospital.R rankhospital <- function(state_real, outcome_real, num_real = "best") { # NHP D LIU library(here) working_wd <- getwd() file_outcome_csv <- here(working_wd, "example", "1", "outcome-of-care-measures.csv") outcome <- read.csv(file_outcome_csv, colClasses = "character", na.strings = "Not Available") lean_data <- outcome[, c(2, 7, 11, 17, 23)] colnames(lean_data) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") unique_name <- unique(lean_data$state) if (match(state_real, unique_name, nomatch = "0") > 0) { } else { print("invalid state") stop() } if (match(outcome_real, c("heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia"), nomatch = "0") > 0) { } else { print("invalid outcome") stop() } ###### lean_data_state <- split(lean_data, f = list(lean_data$state)) foo <- data.frame(lean_data_state[state_real]) colnames(foo) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") work <- data.frame(cbind(foo[, c("hospital_name", outcome_real)])) good <- complete.cases(work) work_ok <- data.frame(work[good, ][]) # TO RA DATASET CA CT BNH VIN VÀ LOI I MISSING VALUE colnames(work_ok) <- c("hospital_name", outcome_real) yes <- as.numeric(work_ok[, outcome_real]) work_ok[, 2] <- as.numeric(work_ok[, 2]) lll <- work_ok[order(work_ok[, 2]), ] eee <- lll[order(lll[, 2], lll[, 1]), ] # SP XP THEO TH T RATE VÀ THEO TH T ALPHABET TRONG HOSPITAL NAME rank_num <- length(eee$hospital_name) rank_real <- c(1:rank_num) rrr <- cbind(eee, rank_real) # TR RA 1 BNG KT QU FULLSET RI if (num_real == "best") { num_real <- min(rrr[, 3]) } else { if (num_real == "worst") { num_real <- max(rrr[, 3]) } else { if(num_real > 0 & num_real < max(rrr[, 3])) { num_real == num_real } else{ print("NA") stop() } #else3 } #else2 } #else1 happy <- rrr[which(rrr[, 3] == num_real), ] result_1 <- paste(happy[1]) print(result_1) } 6.2.2.1 TEST HÀM rankhospital("TX", "heart failure", 4) ## [1] "DETAR HOSPITAL NAVARRO" rankhospital("MD", "heart attack", "worst") ## [1] "HARFORD MEMORIAL HOSPITAL" #rankhospital("MN", "heart attack", 5000) # NU HNG VT QUA S LIU THÌ S HIN RA 'NA'. 6.2.3 TÌM CÁC BNH VIN CÓ CÙNG HNG  TT C CÁC BANG Ranking hospitals in all states Lu hàm  file rankall.R # TO HÀM TH NHT XP HNG BNH VIN  TNG BANG rankhospital <- function(state_real, outcome_real, num_real = "best") { # NHP D LIU library(here) working_wd <- getwd() file_outcome_csv <- here(working_wd, "example", "1", "outcome-of-care-measures.csv") outcome <- read.csv(file_outcome_csv, colClasses = "character", na.strings = "Not Available") lean_data <- outcome[, c(2, 7, 11, 17, 23)] colnames(lean_data) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") unique_name <- unique(lean_data$state) if (match(state_real, unique_name, nomatch = "0") > 0) { } else { print("invalid state") stop() } if (match(outcome_real, c("heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia"), nomatch = "0") > 0) { } else { print("invalid outcome") stop() } ###### lean_data_state <- split(lean_data, f = list(lean_data$state)) foo <- data.frame(lean_data_state[state_real]) colnames(foo) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") work <- data.frame(cbind(foo[, c("hospital_name", outcome_real, "state")])) colnames(work) <- c("hospital_name", outcome_real, "state") work[, 2] <- as.numeric(work[, 2]) ############# TO RA DATAFRAME TNG NG TNG STATE ############# good <- complete.cases(work) work <- data.frame(work[good, ][]) # TO RA DATASET CA CT BNH VIN VÀ LOI I MISSING VALUE colnames(work) <- c("hospital_name", outcome_real, "state") fff <- work[order(work[, 2], work[, 1]), ] # SP XP THEO TH T RATE VÀ THEO TH T ALPHABET TRONG HOSPITAL NAME rank_num <- length(fff$hospital_name) rank_real <- c(1:rank_num) rrr <- cbind(fff, rank_real) # TR RA 1 BNG KT QU FULLSET RI if (num_real == "best") { num_real <- min(rrr[, 4]) } else { if (num_real == "worst") { num_real <- max(rrr[, 4]) } else { if(num_real > 0 & num_real < max(rrr[, 4])) { num_real == num_real } else{ aaaa <- "NA" bbbb <- state_real kkkk <- cbind(aaaa, bbbb) colnames(kkkk) <- c("hospital_name", "state") return(paste(kkkk[, 1:2])) #stop() # LU Ý  IN RA KT QU NA THÌ PHI TT HÀM NÀY } #else3 } #else2 } #else1 happy <- rrr[which(rrr[, 4] == num_real), ] return((paste(happy[, c(1, 3)]))) } # CHECK NI B CHO HÀM 1 #rankhospital("AK", "heart attack", 10) #rankhospital("AL", "heart attack", 20) #################### # THIT K HÀM 2 CÓ BN CHT LÀ MT VÒNG LP TNG BANG VÀO DA THEO HÀM 1 rankall <- function(outcome_real, num_real = "best") { # NHP D LIU library(here) working_wd <- getwd() file_outcome_csv <- here(working_wd, "example", "1", "outcome-of-care-measures.csv") outcome <- read.csv(file_outcome_csv, colClasses = "character", na.strings = "Not Available") lean_data <- outcome[, c(2, 7, 11, 17, 23)] colnames(lean_data) <- c("hospital_name", "state", "heart attack", "heart failure", "pneumonia") unique_name <- unique(lean_data$state) lll_a <- unique_name[order(unique_name[])] ## SP XP TH T CA STATE THEO ABC extract_data <- data.frame(matrix(ncol = 4, nrow = 0)) for(ok in seq_along(lll_a)){ state_real <- lll_a[ok] extract_1 <- rankhospital(state_real, outcome_real, num_real) extract_data <- rbind(extract_data, extract_1) } colnames(extract_data) <- c("hospital_name", "state") return(extract_data) } 6.2.3.1 TEST HÀM check-package.html
Chapter 7 CHECK PACKAGE

Chapter 7 CHECK PACKAGE Source: https://vbaliga.github.io/verify-that-r-packages-are-installed-and-loaded/ ## If a package is installed, it will be loaded. If any ## are not, the missing package(s) will be installed ## from CRAN and then loaded. ## First specify the packages of interest packages = c("tidyverse", "geomorph", "phytools", "viridis") ## Now load or install & load all package.check <- lapply( packages, FUN = function(x) { if (!require(x, character.only = TRUE)) { install.packages(x, dependencies = TRUE) library(x, character.only = TRUE) } } ) Cách này áp dng  kim tra xem package ã có cha thì cài t và loading.
